Crimes.Crime_Name: Overstaying visa or immigration status due to criminal conviction and subsequent deportation order
Crimes.Violation_Type: Immigration status violation due to criminal conviction
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Is Mr. Kim protected from removal under IRPA as a mandate refugee or member of the Indochinese Designated Class?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Mr. Kim was admitted as a permanent resident, not as a refugee; his criminal convictions led to a deportation order; UNHCR status does not grant automatic protection under Canadian law
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Mr. Kim is not protected from removal under IRPA
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review dismissed; no error found in PRRA decision
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Permanent resident, former member of Indochinese Designated Class
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Deportation following criminal conviction despite historical refugee-related admission
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Only Convention refugees or protected persons are exempt from removal; serious criminals excluded unless specific risk criteria are met
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Nature of criminal convictions, lack of refugee status, risk upon return
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Jurisdiction of PRRA officer to assess case
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Criminal record, immigration history, UNHCR documentation
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on protected persons and removal exemptions
Crimes.Application_Basis: PRRA assessment based on risk of persecution or torture upon return
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Criminal history, country conditions in Cambodia, personal circumstances
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal based on refugee protection claims
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Under IRPA, only Convention refugees or protected persons are exempt from removal. Serious criminals are excluded unless they meet specific risk criteria
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to demonstrate significant risk of torture or persecution in Cambodia
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm upon return not substantiated
Crimes.Cause_Description: Mr. Kim's criminal convictions led to a deportation order despite his admission under the Indochinese Designated Class
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: PRRA officer properly assessed available evidence
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA sections related to inadmissibility and removal
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No procedural unfairness in evidence evaluation
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA s. 112(3)(b) and related provisions on protected persons
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Whether PRRA officer had jurisdiction over Mr. Kim’s case
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Mr. Kim not a protected person under IRPA; criminal history triggers deportability
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard applied to PRRA decision

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Is Mr. Kim protected from deportation under IRPA given his serious criminal convictions?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Mr. Kim convicted of crimes in Canada with sentence over two years; PRRA application failed to prove risk upon return to Cambodia
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Mr. Kim not protected from deportation under IRPA
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review dismissed; no reviewable error found
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Cambodian national, former member of Indochinese Designated Class, permanent resident
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Commission of serious criminal offenses in Canada
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Inadmissibility under IRPA due to criminality despite humanitarian considerations
Crimes.Legal_Standard: IRPA s. 112(3)(b): serious criminals excluded from protection unless facing torture or persecution
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Severity of crime, length of sentence, risk assessment upon return
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Proper application of legal standards by PRRA officer
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Criminal records, sentencing documents, country condition reports
Crimes.Application_Basis: Assessment of whether removal would subject individual to torture or cruel treatment
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Criminal history, rehabilitation efforts, conditions in Cambodia
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Prevention of deportation based on risk claims
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Individuals with serious criminality are excluded from protection unless they meet specific risk criteria
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence to establish substantial risk of harm upon return
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of torture or persecution not established
Crimes.Cause_Description: Mr. Kim's criminal offenses led to his declaration as a danger to the public and subsequent deportation order
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: PRRA officer fairly evaluated all submitted materials
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA s. 112(3)(b) – serious criminality grounds for inadmissibility
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No procedural irregularities in evidence consideration
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: PRRA officer had authority to assess the case
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Thorough and consistent with statutory requirements
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Conviction for serious crime and failure to demonstrate personal risk upon return
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Standard of reasonableness in administrative decision-making
